# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    result = ""
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            result *= current_line * "\n"
            current_line = word
        else
            if current_line != ""
                current_line *= " "
            end
            current_line *= word
        end
    end

    result *= current_line
    return result
end

# Example usage:
println(wrap_string("This is a test string that needs to be wrapped at a certain width"))
```

This function splits the input string into words and then iterates over them. If adding a word to the current line would exceed the maximum width, it adds the current line to the result and starts a new line with the current word. Otherwise, it adds the word to the current line. Finally, it adds the last line to the result.
